big_picture_notes: Revelation blends epistle (1:4), prophecy (1:3; 22:7,10), and apocalypse (1:1). Its macro‑architecture is heptadic: letters to seven churches, then three septets (seals, trumpets, bowls), framed by the epistolary prologue and the new‑creation epilogue. Recapitulation cycles, OT allusions, parataxis, and inclusios/chiasms shape the vision. Titles like ‘Alpha and Omega’ frame the whole (1:8; 22:13). Scene divisions often follow speaker changes, vision formulae (‘I saw…’), or completed symbolic units.

stories.story_title: The Mandate and the Seven Candlesticks
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) title/prologue; end (3:22) the seventh ‘hear what the Spirit says’ closes the church oracles. Glue: sevenfold pattern (churches/spirits/lampstands), repeated oracle formulas (‘to the angel… write…’, ‘he who has an ear…’), and the commission ‘write what you have seen…’ (1:19).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Apocalypse superscription; blessing on reader/hearers. Devices: prologue benediction, prophecy self‑designation.
‘John to the seven churches…’; Alpha/Omega declaration closes. Devices: tricolon of Christ’s titles, doxology, coming‑with‑clouds oracle, inclusio title.

scenes.scene_name: John’s Setting and the Son of Man Vision
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Patmos, in the Spirit; lampstands/Son of Man described. Devices: Danielic imagery, similes (eyes flame, feet bronze), trumpet‑voice.
‘Do not fear; I am First and Last’; write the seen/now/later; stars/lampstands explained. Devices: theophany speech, interpretive gloss.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Ephesus — Lost First Love
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Angel‑address, commend/complaint/call/promise; tree of life. Devices: structured oracle, Eden allusion.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Smyrna — Crown of Life
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Poverty yet rich; testing; second death immunity. Devices: irony, synagogue of Satan, victor’s crown.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Pergamum — Hidden Manna & White Stone
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Where Satan’s throne; Balaam/Balak; promise of manna/stone. Devices: typology with Numbers, symbolic gifts.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Thyatira — Jezebel and Iron Rod
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Tolerance of ‘Jezebel’; judgment; rule with iron rod; morning star. Devices: OT Jezebel echo, Psalm 2 allusion.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Sardis — Wake Up; White Garments
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Name of life yet dead; watchfulness; book of life. Devices: thief‑coming simile, vesture imagery.
Key of David; little power yet faithful; pillar in temple; new names. Devices: Isaiah key imagery, New Jerusalem inscription.

scenes.scene_name: Oracle to Laodicea — Lukewarm and Supper
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Rich yet poor/blind; buy refined gold/eye salve; I stand at the door and knock. Devices: irony, intimate meal invitation, throne promise.

stories.story_title: The Throne Room and the Seven Seals
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:1) ‘Come up here’ moves to the heavenly vision; end (8:1) silence at seventh seal closes the first septet. Glue: throne‑scene doxologies, the Lamb and the sealed scroll, rhythmic ‘Come!’ of the first four seals, and interlude protection of the saints.

scenes.scene_name: Throne and Worship of the Creator
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Open door; four living beings and elders; crowns cast; ‘worthy are you’ hymn. Devices: Ezekiel/Isaiah echoes, liturgical refrain.
No one worthy; John weeps. Devices: narrative tension around sealed book, strong angel proclamation.
Elder: lion has conquered; seen as slain lamb; cascading doxologies to the Lamb. Devices: Christological irony, three‑tier chorus.
‘Come!’; white/red/black/pale horses; a fourth of earth affected. Devices: color‑symbolism, repetitive summons, parallel judgments.

scenes.scene_name: Fifth Seal — Cry of the Martyrs
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Souls under altar ask ‘how long?’; given white robes, told to rest. Devices: altar imagery, oracle of delay.
Quake, darkened sun, blood‑moon, falling stars; ‘who can stand?’ Devices: catastrophe similes, day‑of‑wrath question.
Winds restrained; servants sealed from tribes; numbered census. Devices: pause motif, twelve‑thousand refrain.
Innume­rable worshipers; elder interprets; shepherding/Lamb wipes tears. Devices: liturgy, interpretive dialogue, Exodus‑tabernacle echo.
Opened; half‑hour silence in heaven. Devices: dramatic pause, septet closure.

stories.story_title: The Seven Trumpets and Temple Interludes
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (8:2) seven angels with trumpets and incense; end (11:19) seventh trumpet and opened temple/ark. Glue: trumpet sequence with interposed visions (little scroll, two witnesses), and ‘woe’ eagle marking last three trumpets.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Seven angels receive trumpets; incense with prayers; censer cast to earth. Devices: altar/prayer linkage, thunder/lightning prelude.
Hail‑fire, burning mountain, Wormwood, darkened lights. Devices: Exodus plagues echo, fourfold natural spheres.
‘Woe, woe, woe’ to earth‑dwellers for remaining blasts. Devices: solitary herald scene, transition marker.
Abyss opened; locusts torment five months; king Abaddon. Devices: abyss imagery, constrained judgment, name wordplay.

scenes.scene_name: Sixth Trumpet — Horsemen and No Repentance
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Four angels released at Euphrates; myriad horsemen; mankind does not repent. Devices: numeric hyperbole, idolatry catalog.
Colossal angel; seven thunders sealed; scroll sweet/bitter; John to prophesy again. Devices: oath stance, sealed utterance, recommissioning.
Temple measured; two witnesses prophesy, are slain, raised; quake strikes city. Devices: Zechariah echoes, prophetic pattern death→vindication.
‘The kingdom… has become the Lord’s and his Christ’; worship; temple opened and ark seen. Devices: royal proclamation, doxology, covenant‑ark epiphany.

stories.story_title: The Woman, the Dragon, and the Beasts
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (12:1) great sign in heaven; end (14:20) double harvest completes conflict‑cycle contrast with the Lamb’s company and messages. Glue: woman/dragon war, sea/earth beasts (authority/propaganda), then Lamb/144,000 and three‑angel gospel and warnings.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Pregnant woman; dragon seeks child; child caught up; woman flees. Devices: sign imagery, wilderness motif.

scenes.scene_name: War in Heaven; Woe to Earth
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Michael defeats dragon; accuser cast down; saints conquer by blood/word. Devices: victory hymn, timing (‘short time’).
Serpent pursues; earth helps; war on her offspring. Devices: Exodus echo (flood/earth), remnant identification.
Composite beast empowered; mortal wound healed; worship; saints’ endurance call. Devices: Daniel 7 allusions, captivity/sword saying.
Signs deceive; image of the beast; mark and number 666. Devices: counterfeit signs, economic coercion, wisdom riddle.
New song, spotless company; firstfruits to God and Lamb. Devices: purity motif, name/seal contrast with mark.
Eternal gospel, Babylon fallen, warning against worshiping the beast; blessed the dead in the Lord. Devices: triadic proclamations, endurance/faith of saints.

scenes.scene_name: Harvest of Earth — Grain and Grapes
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Son of Man reaps; angel harvests grapes to winepress. Devices: double harvest imagery, judgment blood‑flow vision.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (15:1) sign: seven angels with seven last plagues; end (16:21) seventh bowl ‘It is done’ with quake/hail. Glue: preparatory sanctuary vision (song of Moses/Lamb), then rapid bowls 1–6 and Armageddon, culminating in final bowl.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Victors sing; temple of tent opens; angels receive bowls. Devices: Exodus song reprise, smoke‑filled sanctuary.
Sores, sea/blood, rivers blood, sun scorch, darkness, Euphrates dried; spirits gather kings to Armageddon. Devices: plague parallels, parenthetical warning ‘I come like a thief’.
Bowl on air; lightning, quake; great hail; Babylon remembered. Devices: theophanic storm, consummation formula, city‑split image.

stories.story_title: Babylon the Great Judged and the Wedding Announced
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (17:1) angel shows judgment of the great prostitute; end (19:10) hallelujahs and marriage supper; John admonished not to worship angel. Glue: vision + interpretation (17), laments over Babylon (18), and heaven’s rejoicing and bride made ready (19:1–10).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Carried to wilderness; woman on scarlet beast; drunk with saints’ blood. Devices: wilderness sign, luxury/abomination contrast.

scenes.scene_name: Angel’s Interpretation of Beast and Woman
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Seven heads/ten horns explained; war on the Lamb, the Lamb conquers. Devices: riddling exegesis, paradox ‘was/is not/is to come’.

scenes.scene_name: The Woman’s Doom by the Beast’s Allies
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Waters = peoples; horns hate the prostitute; God’s purpose fulfilled. Devices: symbol key, sovereignty motif.
Another angel illumines; fallen is Babylon; call to depart; double repayment. Devices: prophetic oracle style, merchant/city imagery.
Threefold lament; sudden desolation; found no more. Devices: repetitive ‘in one hour’, trade catalog, millstone simile.
Great multitude praises; marriage of the Lamb; blessed are invited; ‘worship God’ correction. Devices: liturgical crescendo, beatitude, testimony of Jesus definition.

stories.story_title: Final Victory and the Last Judgment
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (19:11) rider on white horse appears; end (20:15) great white throne judgment concludes present order. Glue: defeat of beast/false prophet, binding/release of Satan, and judgment of the dead from the books.

scenes.scene_name: The Rider on the White Horse
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Faithful and True judges/wages war; robe dipped in blood; King of kings. Devices: warfare theophany, name/titles cascade.
Birds’ supper; beast captured; false prophet cast into lake of fire. Devices: banquet reversal (contrast with wedding), swift judgment.
Satan bound; saints reign thousand years; blessed holy participants. Devices: chaining motif, reign/rest imagery.
Released deceives nations; fire from heaven; devil cast into lake of fire. Devices: brief recapitulative battle, eternal torment note.
Earth/sky flee; books opened; death and Hades thrown into lake of fire; anyone not in book of life cast in. Devices: courtroom imagery, book‑of‑life antithesis.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (21:1) new heaven and new earth; end (22:21) final grace blessing. Glue: bride‑city vision, throne/river/tree, repeated ‘I am coming soon’, blessings and warnings, and Alpha/Omega inclusio.

scenes.scene_name: New Heaven and New Earth; Overcomers’ Promise
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: No sea; God dwells with them; all things new; overcomer vs cowardly. Devices: creation reversal, ‘It is done’ echo, inheritance language.
Carried to a great mountain; city/bride shown; measures, foundations, jewels, gates. Devices: angelic tour, symbolic geometry and gem‑catalog.

scenes.scene_name: Glory of God as Its Light
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: No temple; nations walk by its light; nothing unclean enters. Devices: templelessness motif, nations/kingdoms inclusion.

scenes.scene_name: River and Tree of Life; Reign Forever
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: River from the throne; tree of life heals nations; they see his face and reign. Devices: Eden restored, beatific vision, servant‑reign.
Faithful/true words; keep prophecy; do not seal; coming soon; Alpha and Omega. Devices: angel/Jesus speeches, urgency refrains.
Blessed who wash robes; Spirit and bride say ‘Come’; warning against adding/removing; grace be with all. Devices: open invitation, canonical warning, epistolary grace close.
